<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10236298777/job/28318188083)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10236298777/job/28318188175)

This looks good to me. (1 minor comment)

@riccardobrasca do you want to have another look?
Sorry, I forgot about this PR. Besides some (very) minor typos, I think this is good to go.
Sorry, I forgot about this PR. Besides some (very) minor typos, I think this is good to go.

This looks good to me. (1 minor comment)

@riccardobrasca do you want to have another look?
Should this be expressed in terms of [Module.IsTorsionBySet](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Torsion.html#Module.IsTorsionBySet)?
I added it as a separate lemma.
I think a more fitting filename would be `Mathlib.RingTheory.Smooth.Differentials` (or maybe `Mathlib.RingTheory.Smooth.Kaehler`).

```suggestion
  Given a surjective algebra homomorphism `f : P →ₐ[R] S` with square-zero kernel `I`,
  there is a one-to-one correspondence between algebra homomorphism sections of `f`
  and `P`-linear retractions to `I →ₗ[P] S ⊗[P] Ω[P/R]`.
```
(more occurences below)

```suggestion
/--
Given an algebra hom `f : P →ₐ[R] S` with square-zero kernel `I`,
and a section `g : S →ₐ[R] P` (as an algebra hom),
we get an `R`-derivation `P → I` via `x ↦ x - g (f x)`.
-/
@[simps]
def derivationOfSectionOfKerSqZero : Derivation R P (RingHom.ker (algebraMap P S)) where
```
Surjectivity is not in the assumptions.
Also I find it confusing that the docstring mentions an algebra homomorphism `f`, but there is no `f` since `f` is just `IsScalarTower.toAlgHom R P S`.
Maybe generalize to arbitrary algebra homomorphisms `f` and then specialize to `[Algebra P S] [IsScalarTower R P S]`?
It is morally in the assumption as implied by the existence of a section.

```suggestion
def retractionOfSectionOfKerSqZero : S ⊗[P] Ω[P⁄R] →ₗ[P] RingHom.ker (algebraMap P S) :=
  letI := g.toRingHom.toAlgebra
  haveI := isScalarTower_of_section_of_ker_sqZero hf' g hg
  letI f := (derivationOfSectionOfKerSqZero hf' g hg).liftKaehlerDifferential
  (AlgebraTensorModule.lift ((LinearMap.ringLmapEquivSelf S S _).symm f)).restrictScalars P
```

```suggestion
Given an algebra homomorphism `f : P →ₐ[R] S` with square-zero kernel `I`,
let `σ` be an arbitrary (set-theoretic) section of `f`.
Suppose we have a retraction `l` of the injection `I →ₗ[P] S ⊗[P] Ω[P/R]`, then
`x ↦ σ x - l (1 ⊗ D (σ x))` is an algebra homomorphism and a section to `f`.
```
The `l` appears twice.
same as above
Maybe show this for `sectionOfRetractionKerToTensorAux` and then specialize?
The equiv is defined the other way round.

```suggestion
there is a one-to-one correspondence between `P`-linear retractions of `I →ₗ[P] S ⊗[P] Ω[P/R]`
```

```suggestion
we get an `R`-derivation `P → I` via `x ↦ x - g (f x)`.
```

```suggestion
```
Is this name the wrong way round? `kerToTensor` is on the LHS...

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Smooth): Correspondence between square-zero lifts and retractions of the conormal sequence.
